alert.note: Alert for Hale; Lubbock (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 11:44PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm outflow winds will impact portions of Lubbock and southeastern Hale Counties through 1215 AM CDT... At 1143 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking the leading edge of strong outflow wind gusts 5 miles northeast of Shallowater, or 7 miles south of Abernathy, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lubbock, Abernathy, Wolfforth, Shallowater, Idalou, Ransom Canyon, Lubbock South Plains Mall, Texas Tech University, Lubbock International Airport, Downtown Lubbock, Reese Center, New Deal, Buffalo Springs and Lubbock Science Spectrum. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
